commitResults.messageBody:
Duke class: add printWithBorders() method

This method takes a string as input and prints it within borders before
and after the string.

Duke class: add while-loop within main() to provide basic functionality

The while-loop receives inputs from the user and echos it back.
If the string "bye" is given, the program terminates with a goodbye message.

commitResults.messageTitle: modified Duke.java to provide functionality for Level-2
commitResults.messageBody:
Implemented a String array (named `records`) to contain user entries.
Since it can be assumed that there will be at most 100 entries, a fixed size
array initialised to 100 was implemented.

Modified the while-loop in Duke.main() to add entries to `records`.

Modified the while-loop in Duke.main() to list out entries in `records`.

Encapsulation of a task as an object (containing its description and
status).

TaskStatus provides enumeration of completion status of tasks
(currently, only either pending or completed).

commitResults.messageTitle: modify Duke.java to keep track of task completion status
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename `records` to `tasks` so as to make naming more intuitive.

Change tasks from String[] to Task[] as tasks are now stored as Task
objects instead of String.

Modify program loop to enable listing of tasks with completion status
and also ability to mark tasks as complete.

commitResults.messageTitle: add Deadline.java, Todo.java, Event.java and TaskType.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Add TaskType.java to provide enumerations for task types.

Add Deadline, Todo and Even classes which are sub-classes of Task to support different for the three types of entries.

Modify Duke.java to reduce repeated print statements by streamlining
the message generation step to create a new StringBuilder object before
the program-loop and then a single call to print out the message at the
end.

Modify Task.java to add method to parse user input in order to
determine the type of Task the user has entered and process them in their own
task-specific manner.

Modify input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT to have updated test
cases in line with recent changes to the programme.
modified output of "list" command to also include the proper headers

commitResults.messageTitle: modified Task and sub-classes to throw Exceptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Modified Task.java, Deadline.java, Task.java and Todo.java to throw
DukeExceptions when parsing errors are encountered

Modify Duke.java to catch DukeExceptions thrown by methods in the
program-loop when errors/incorrect inputs are encountered. Also modify program loop
to throw DukeExceptions on unknown commands.
Modify Duke.java to use an ArrayList to store tasks instead of Task[] array.

commitResults.messageTitle: modify Duke.java to support deletion of tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Modify Duke.java program-loop to support "delete" command

commitResults.messageTitle: modify Duke.java to display correct exception message

commitResults.messageBody:
Modify test cases to support newly added functionality
such as exceptions and deletions.

commitResults.messageTitle: modify Task.java to use switch instead of if-else block
modify Duke.java to throw exceptions on invalid options
modify test cases to test new additions
commitResults.messageBody:
modify test cases to test for proper behaviour when a "done" or
"delete" command is provided with a number that is invalid.
